snippet: Deutsche Bank will pay the government $200 million to settle accusations that it misled the Department of Housing and Urban Development about the quality of mortgages that later defaulted.
abstract: Deutsche Bank agrees to pay the federal government more than $200 million to settle accusations that it knowingly misled the Department of Housing and Urban Development about the quality of mortgages that later defaulted; defaults ultimately cost United States taxpayers $368 million.
lead_paragraph: Deutsche Bank will pay the government $200 million to settle accusations that it misled the Department of Housing and Urban Development about the quality of mortgages that later defaulted.

headline.seo: Deutsche Bank Settles U.S. Mortgage Suit
headline.main: Bank to Pay $202 Million To Settle Suit On Mortgages
headline.print_headline: Bank to Pay $202 Million To Settle Suit On Mortgages
